MacGruber.Action: Greets Colonel Faith and Lieutenant Piper calmly while meditating.
Performs a backflip onto his feet when approached, showing confidence but friendly energy.
Refers to himself as 'expendable government pawn' humorously and self-deprecatingly.
Performs a backflip from a seated meditation position onto his feet, showing physical agility and control.
Wears monk robes and appears to be in deep meditation, suggesting a disciplined and focused mindset.
Speaks confidently and with a hint of humor when greeting Colonel Faith, indicating self-assurance.
Self-describes as an expendable government pawn despite legendary status, showing a degree of humility or self-awareness.
Softly pats children on their heads while surrounded by them, expresses that his life and people in the monastery are what he cares about.
Tells the Colonel 'the answer is no' firmly indicating refusal to help with the mission.
Shows patience and calm by watching the kid who ran off with his watch instead of reacting harshly.
Refuses to reengage with the mission despite urgent appeals, citing a promise to himself and his desire for peace.
Calmly refuses a mission despite pressure, shows confidence in his decision to stay at the monastery focusing on peace.
Allows a child to steal his watch but decides to follow instead of forcefully retrieving it.
Acknowledges the seriousness of the X5 nuclear warhead but maintains his refusal to reengage.
Insists he's done enough for his country and firmly resists calls to reenter dangerous operations.
Refuses to pursue taking down Cunth despite the danger.
Displays vulnerability and regret in tossing and turning at night.
Lunges at Casey trying to protect her from danger.
Shows hesitation and reluctance to take on the mission to stop Cunth despite the high stakes.
Has detailed dossiers, surveillance photos, and schematics related to the threat, indicating thorough preparation.
Tosses and turns in bed, seemingly troubled and unable to focus or act decisively.
Bolts up in bed drenched in sweat after a nightmare, showing emotional vulnerability.
Throws a kerosene lamp at a picture in anger, an impulsive and destructive act.
Travels to cemetery at night and digs up a grave with intensity and gusto, demonstrating determination and physical capability.
Pry opens a coffin and reveals his former life belongings, showing resourcefulness and focus.
Puts on his old adventure wear and accesses a secret compartment with a digital lock using a code and fingerprint scanner, displaying technical savvy and preparedness.
Says 'I’m in' confidently bursting into rooms, showing eagerness to help and engage with the team.
Jokes with Piper by calling her 'Rookie' in a familiar way.
Demands to kill the antagonist without judge or jury, suggesting a lack of trust in due process.
Rejects Lieutenant Piper as a teammate with hostility and physical aggression.
Determines to assemble his own team of 'killer stoppers' to face a dangerous threat.
Asserts he will put together his own dream team of killer stoppers in response to the enemy's team of ruthless criminals.
Rejects Lieutenant Piper as an ally based on Piper's lack of experience and immediately resorts to physical dominance to assert this.
Demonstrates physical skill and confidence by quickly incapacitating Piper with a control move and a strike.
Storms out impulsively and dismisses potentially helpful assistance from the police force, showing reluctance to collaborate.
Parks his car diagonally across two spaces to avoid it getting dings, thoughtfully takes his portable stereo with him.
Engages in friendly banter and warmly greets his old friend Frank, shares casual humor.
Puts on driving gloves and sunglasses with blinders, starts engine confidently, shifts gears while driving out of parking garage.
Parks car diagonally across two spaces to avoid dings, takes portable stereo with him.
Offers to spot Frank during workout, showing awareness and readiness to assist.
Admits he hasn't ripped any throats out lately and questions if he remembers how it’s done anymore.
Tells Frank he can count on him and they clasp hands, showing trust and reliance.
Exchanges friendly banter with Tanker during a weapons practice, calling each other 'same old,' indicating camaraderie.
Needs Frank's help for a serious mission and confidently secures his support.
Skillfully catches a knife flung at his head and returns it accurately.
Successfully identifies and checks off multiple key individuals on his list through direct engagement, indicating organization and methodical progress.
Puts a grenade in the homeless vet’s cup as a method of recruitment or signal, executed without immediate issue, showing unconventional but effective tactics.
Approaches Vicki St. Elmo with confidence despite the emotional tension, steeling himself before knocking, indicating emotional preparedness and social competence.
Engages with people in a casual and personable manner (handshakes, smiles) building rapport quickly, demonstrating interpersonal skills.
Encourages and motivates Vicki despite her doubts and refusal, showing confidence and persistence in recruiting.
Hands Vicki a crumpled note with a key location despite poor handwriting, demonstrating focus on the mission but somewhat careless presentation.
Expresses emotional connection and shared loss with Vicki, indicating empathy but no clear demonstration of skill at this point.
Engages in playful banter with Piper despite apparent hostility.
Refuses to let Piper join the team, citing personal dislike and using harsh language.
Confidently leads his team and discusses their qualifications with assurance.
Engages in petty insults and banter with Piper, which distracts from professionalism.
Refuses to reconsider team composition even when presented with potentially useful additions.
Runs to van explosion site and cries, calling out for his friends' safety.
Delivers emotional eulogies, showing genuine grief and respect for fallen comrades.
Expresses regret and sorrow for surviving when others died.
Uses heavy profanity during sensitive moments around others, including children at funerals.
Insists on staying on the case despite being removed, showing stubbornness but also dedication.
Allows a van filled with explosives and ammunition to explode, resulting in death and destruction.
Reactively searches wreckage and shows emotional distress, indicating inability to manage the crisis effectively.
Gives eulogies at funerals which are emotionally genuine but use inappropriate language.
Refuses to accept being taken off the case despite poor outcomes and emotional instability.
Expresses desperation and vulnerability by apologizing and breaking down emotionally to Piper, admitting his mistakes and feeling hated.
Initially insults Piper harshly before quickly retracting and apologizing.
Begging and offering extreme favors in a crude manner to convince Piper to join his team.
Insists he is the best chance and tries to rally support despite being rejected.
Breaks down emotionally, admitting he doesn’t know what he’s doing, showing self-doubt and loss of control.
Apologizes and attempts to negotiate with Piper, showing vulnerability but also desperation and lack of professional tact.
Cries on the ground, admits to feeling lost and overwhelmed.
Shares the painful truth about his wife’s death and his motivation to prevent others from suffering similarly.
Nods appreciatively to Piper when she joins the team; visibly in pain but open.
Has pants off in a vulnerable but awkward state, showing lack of social grace.
Has his pants off and is unprepared, looking for unconventional substitutes for lubricant like white-out or toner.
Admits openly that he doesn't know what he's doing and crumples to the ground crying.
Expresses emotional pain and struggle but remains self-aware about the stakes involved.
Accepts responsibility by apologizing for letting others down and showing emotional depth.
Smiles with hope when offered additional help, showing positive engagement and openness to support.
Smiles at Faith and expresses confidence in forming a new team.
Responds to a rude comment with a hostile 'Fuck you!'
Uses violence against the bartender and threatens to kill a woman to assert control, though assures the woman 'she's safe' afterward.
Identifies the location and target, assembles a new team confidently.
Recalls a license plate number from a passing car, showing attention to detail.
Aggressively interrogates bartender by slamming his head on the bar, but quickly determines the bartender is useless.
Takes control of the nightclub by ordering the music off and threatening violence to get attention.
Uses a panic-inducing tactic (headlock on teammate) to assert control in public.
Throws bottles and mic destructively while delivering an intimidating speech, revealing personal motivation and confidence.
Publicly announces his intent to go after a dangerous enemy and arranges a meeting time and place.
Flips off a security camera before exiting the location.
Interprets the chaotic, aggressive behavior as sending a message that will be received loud and clear.
Admits he is not good with plans or clues but is confident in his ability to fight and defend, showing honesty and self-awareness.
Flips off the camera with both hands in a surveillance photo, a rude and confrontational gesture.
Admits he doesn't have a plan and improvises as he goes.
Confidently faces his adversary on his own turf, playing to his strengths in combat.
Spruces Vicki up after surprising her, uses a playful tone.
Reassures Piper and Vicki about the danger from Cunth, shows protective attitude.
Acknowledges Vicki's capability to take care of herself, expresses confidence in her.
Makes a compliment to Vicki by telling her she looks pretty.
Dismisses Vicki’s concerns about the plan and imposes his view.
Reassures Vicki that they have her back and will be close if anything happens.
Teases Vicki about the distance exaggeration (seven blocks vs. twenty blocks).
Encourages Vicki to follow his instructions and jokes with her about ordering a large Tazo tea instead of a latte.
Tells Vicki not to tip the cashier, causing her to feel guilty.
Coordinates a surveillance operation with Vicki, providing instructions and strategic advice remotely.
Admits and downplays being farther away than originally stated (20 blocks vs 7 blocks), showing honesty but potentially overestimating capability to assist.
Gives specific behavioral instructions to Vicki regarding how to blend in and avoid suspicion, demonstrating situational awareness.
Advises against tipping and suggests specific drink orders to maintain cover, showing attention to detail.
Fails to consider the social awkwardness and potential suspicion caused when Vicki awkwardly reclaims her tip, indicating a lapse in social competence.
Tells Vicki she has nothing to apologize for, reassuring her.
Commands Piper sharply ('Hand me that Swiffer and that is an order!').
Calmly directs Vicki on how to prepare her coffee precisely and efficiently.
Panics loudly and ineffectively under fire, screaming for help.
Commands Piper assertively to hand him the Swiffer even while under attack.
Ingenuously uses the Swiffer to jam the accelerator and escape from a shooting situation.
Reassures Vicki that he is alive and will be there soon, calming her down.
Dismissively refers to dead Hoss Bender with rude language.
Shows concern for Vicki, asks if she is all right.
Responds politely and appreciatively to Vicki's hug and worry.
Uses flippant and somewhat insensitive language about a teammate's death.
Calms Vicki down after a traumatic event and reassures her he will arrive soon.
Shows nonchalant and somewhat dismissive attitude toward Hoss Bender's death.
Obtains car keys suggesting successful retrieval of useful items despite dangerous circumstances.
Comments sarcastically about the Swiffer, indicating humor but no particular strategic insight.
Acknowledge lack of intel on X5, showing honesty about current limitations.
Reassures Piper and asserts leadership while demanding obedience with a smile.
Compliments Vicki saying she is good at what she does.
Presses the alarm button repeatedly until he hears a chirp from a Cadillac, showing persistence and attention to detail.
Correctly interprets STD as a railroad code, not a common assumption, showing knowledge and insight.
Directs team roles confidently, asserting leadership and clear command.
Plans to retrieve passcodes and acts proactively.
Relies on others to take the riskier or undercover roles, while himself mainly coordinating.
Says 'No, I meant that in a good way. You count as like one and a half people' to Vicki, but then shoots a look at Piper showing he doesn’t truly mean it.
Encourages the team before the mission with a confident 'Okay, let’s do this thing.'
Refuses to use guns, calling them 'for the weak' and 'for the stupid', but allows Piper to use hers.
Engages in planning and prepares a distraction using found objects, showing creativity and taking initiative.
Strategizes to take out guards first to gain numerical advantage and plans next steps with team.
Dismisses use of guns despite facing trained soldiers, relying on improvised distractions instead.
Uses available materials creatively to craft a distraction.
Makes a sarcastic and slightly dismissive comment about a team member's gender, which could undermine team morale.
Distracts guards by dancing naked on the roof with a carrot in his ass to help Piper.
Gives Piper practical advice about the distraction tactic despite Piper rejecting it sarcastically.
Jokes about dead guards needing to admit the distraction worked.
Distracts three armed guards by dancing naked on a rooftop, allowing Piper to take them out silently.
Provides Piper with unconventional but effective advice about distraction tactics.
Leads Piper in sneaking into the warehouse and identifies key targets and their roles confidently.
Encourages Vicki by thanking her bravery and promises to honor her sacrifices even if she does not survive.
Reassures Vicki to keep calm and proceed with the plan despite danger.
Reprimands Piper harshly ('Watch your fucking tone!') when she refuses to lend him the gun.
Shows concern for Vicki by asking if she is all right after a crash.
Encourages Vicki to shake off her fear and keep moving forward ('Well, shake it off, tough lady, we got work to do.')
Continues to focus on the mission despite Vicki being scared, showing some toughness but also practical care.
Uses finger to stir ingredients, causing sticky hands which impair throwing ability; acknowledges the mistake after failure of pine cone throw.
Follows team and stays engaged in pursuit despite limited direct action; encourages Vicki to keep moving after rescue.
Agrees to check dead men for clues and acknowledges limited resources realistically.
Lifts up a carrot to eat and jokes about having washed it, then gives a teasing look to Piper.
Shows frustration and loses his temper on the phone but quickly acknowledges it and accepts Vicki’s advice.
Calls a target a 'piece of shit' and speaks harshly during the phone call.
Attempts to use a cell phone tracer by trying to keep the suspect on the phone to get a location.
Loses his temper and fails to keep the suspect on the phone initially, showing frustration and an impulsive reaction.
Recognizes his mistake, accepts advice from Vicki, and remains hopeful about a second chance when the phone rings again.
Assures Faith in a casual, confident manner about mission leads.
Jokes loosely and acts nervously when the President might be put on the conference call.
Includes himself and others ('us') in being invited to the party, showing inclusion.
Disrespects party security by showing middle finger instead of an invitation.
Claims to have important leads and mission status confidently, but provides no useful or accurate information.
Misinterprets key details about the mission, such as the timing and dress code of the fundraiser.
Abruptly ends a call when pressured with the President being involved, indicating inability or unwillingness to handle high-pressure situations effectively.
Boasts about making the guest list to a high profile event, suggesting some level of infiltration capability.
At party entrance, fails to produce an invitation and instead insults the doorman by showing middle finger, but still manages to enter (possibly through intimidation or arrogance).
Uses wrist mic to communicate with Piper while entering the mansion, showing coordination with team.
Dismisses advice to keep a low profile, prioritizing bravado over stealth.
Quickly locates Vicki by scanning the crowded room effectively.
Distracts with crude humor (upper decker comment) that could be socially awkward or inappropriate in the situation.
Seeks real-time intel from Piper regarding Cunth's location and acts on it.
Smiles dismissively when warned by Vicki not to do anything stupid, indicating possible overconfidence or reckless attitude.
Says 'I can tell by the look in his beady little eyes' to judge a bluff.
Apologizes for misunderstanding: 'Sorry about that. I really thought he was bluffing.'
Makes a rude, threatening comment to Cunth’s daughter: 'Hope you like being date raped, ma’am.'
Apologizes specifically to Cunth’s daughter and explains personal loss: 'Hello. Sorry, he killed my wife.'
Compliments a team member as 'the real deal,' causing Piper to smile and feel appreciated.
Uses hostile language calling Cunth a 'piece of shit' and engages in confrontational insults.
Shows determination to stop Cunth and protect others.
Confidently confronts Cunth and claims to have assembled a new team with highly capable members.
Engages in a verbal duel showing awareness of enemy lies and intentions.
Fails to prevent himself from being surrounded by large henchmen, indicating overconfidence or lack of situational awareness.
Threatens henchmen with extreme violence and crude language.
Complains with frustration and annoyance when his stereo is thrown out.
Aggressively threatens multiple henchmen with specific, violent moves and outcomes.
Gets thrown out the window and loses his car stereo, showing vulnerability and inability to prevent harm.
Apologizes sincerely to Colonel Faith after being reprimanded.
Is reprimanded for recklessness and emotional decision-making, ignoring orders.
Went to Cunth directly to confront him, believing he had him where he wanted him.
Ignores superior officer's warnings and continues with risky approach.
Shows confidence in his plan despite criticism from Colonel Faith.
Fails to prevent Cunth from knowing all his intentions; seen as a liability by superiors.
Fails to stop Cunth from getting passcodes, resulting in being removed from the mission.
Admits defeat and accepts removal from the mission without further protest.
Attempts to placate Faith in an exaggerated and socially inappropriate manner.
Misleads Piper and Vicki about the outcome by initially pretending things went well.
Ultimately honest about being off the case when confronted directly.
Shows humility and takes responsibility for failure in front of teammates.
Engages in playful banter with Vicki about the powder room.
Acknowledges Vicki's qualities sincerely despite denying deeper relationship potential.
Openly apologizes to Piper for bad treatment and admits feeling threatened.
Dismisses Piper's compliment about the relationship with Vicki and shuts down emotional connection.
Confidently states he will never be like Vicki and herself after past experience, showing self-awareness.
Playfully guesses Vicki's bathroom business, demonstrating casual, lighthearted interaction but no clear competence.
Acknowledges he treated Piper badly and apologizes sincerely, showing emotional intelligence but not directly related to competence.
Alert and attentive to danger: hears dog barking, alerts others, and reacts immediately to incoming threat by diving through the air in slow motion.
Jumps behind Piper and uses him as a human shield to protect him from gunfire.
Denies using Piper as a human shield despite evidence and Vicki’s confirmation.
Pulls over and lets Piper out when confronted about using him as a human shield.
Responds to Piper kicking the car by criticizing him sarcastically ("Real mature!").
Allows Vicki to help remove the bullet from his leg despite apparent pain and vulnerability.
Rejects the offered leather belt for biting down during bullet removal, saying 'I deserve pain.'
Expresses self-doubt and vulnerability, asking why Vicki sticks around and admitting he freaked out.
Minimizes the seriousness of his injury ('It’s nothing.') and dismisses the possibility of making mistakes.
Does not flinch when vodka is poured on his open wound, shows high pain tolerance.
Tosses aside the leather belt to bite down on, chooses to endure pain without aid.
Admits to freaking out and losing composure for the first time, shows self-awareness of failure.
Questions his own ability and worth, expresses doubt about his competence and mission.
Displays emotional vulnerability and acceptance of possible failure.
Encourages Vicki gently to express her feelings, showing understanding.
Makes a coarse sexual joke openly and directly.
Caresses Vicki’s cheek and initiates a kiss, showing physical affection and tenderness.
Expresses excitement and intimacy openly during lovemaking, showing passion but also some self-centeredness.
Uses humor in an awkward situation to ease tension with Vicki, showing some social confidence.
Makes an inappropriate sexual comment ('I like holes'), but follows it with a confident, direct approach leading to intimacy.
Takes charge in the romantic/sexual situation, showing confidence and assertiveness.
Interrupts Vicki when she tries to sew him up after injury, choosing to leave wound open, demonstrating unorthodox but deliberate decision-making.
Feels guilt and apologizes to Casey’s grave after being with another woman.
Runs away abruptly after intimacy with Vicki, showing emotional conflict.
Kneels and sincerely communicates with Casey’s ghost, showing respect and emotional attachment.
Engages in mutual affectionate intimacy with Casey’s ghost, showing deep emotional connection.
Abruptly leaves Vicki after intimacy without explanation, showing poor emotional control and decisiveness.
Visits Casey's grave to express guilt, indicating inability to move on and internal conflict.
Interacts emotionally with Casey's ghost, receives reassurance, but continues in confused state.
Engages in a surreal, non-productive intimate montage with Casey’s ghost, suggesting escapism rather than practical action.
Thanks Casey sincerely before walking away.
Expresses strong conviction about threat despite disagreement from Colonel Faith.
Expresses certainty in Cunth's involvement despite official intel indicating otherwise; insists he would stake his life on it.
Immediately calls for extreme measures (evacuate Washington DC) based on his conviction about the threat.
Tells Faith to evacuate the entire eastern seaboard despite uncertainty, showing concern for others' safety.
Responds to Faith's suggestion to take time off by choosing to go save the country instead.
Apologizes to Vicki upon finding her house ransacked, showing remorse and concern.
Immediately searches Vicki’s house frantically after finding it trashed, showing urgency and care.
Calls out to Vicki urgently and asks where she is, showing sincere concern.
Gets furious when threatened about Vicki, indicating protective feelings.
Calms himself to request to hear Vicki's voice to ensure she’s alive, prays silently for success.
Prays for the call tracer to confirm location; then receives confirmation and gets ready to act.
Uses a laser mullet scanner and enters a secret bunker with a high-tech weapons depot, showing preparedness and technical skill.
Organizes and selects unconventional items like gum wrappers, paper clips, tape, and cotton balls as makeshift gear, preparing creatively for confrontation.
Apologizes to Piper for using her as a human shield without permission and promises not to do it again.
Thanks Piper for doing the mission with him.
Makes a jokingly violent comment about hoping the enemies have a ditch dug for bodies.
Secretly ambushes and kills a guard by tearing out his throat to avoid raising alarm.
Exhibits realism about the dangers and potential casualties ahead.
Pushes Piper down just in time to avoid detection by a spotlight, showing quick reflexes and situational awareness.
Acknowledges the close call and immediately plans for a new point of entry, spotting a sewer pipe as an alternative.
Shares a personal, positive moment with Piper about a sexual encounter, showing openness.
Uses aggressive and crude language ('pound some Cunth') repeatedly despite Piper's discomfort.
Carefully approaches the ladder leading to main duct under guard tower with Piper; demonstrates confidence and readiness to proceed with mission.
Uses a repetitive catchphrase 'go pound some Cunth' as a preface before action despite suggestion to focus on action itself; shows lack of adaptability in communication.
Kills a guard by ripping out his throat without hesitation.
Explains bowling jargon to Piper in a casual, friendly way.
Shows ruthless determination to achieve mission by repeatedly killing as needed.
Acknowledges the small team size and shows some understanding of the difficulty.
Tries to reason with enemy to avoid violence; apologizes and acknowledges being outnumbered.
Expresses frustration and stress about equipment failure openly.
Uses loudspeaker to try to negotiate and de-escalate a dangerous situation despite being trapped and under fire.
Accidentally leaves microphone on and reveals their position, leading to a barrage of gunfire.
Quickly realizes the mistake with the foot pedal and attempts to turn it off.
Acknowledges the gravity of the situation aloud and attempts to think through next steps.
Plead to the guards to spare them and promises sincerely not to reveal the compound location.
Shares credit with Piper for the plan despite initially taking more credit.
Sets a trap with a brick on the foot pedal and uses his phone as part of the distraction strategy, leading the guards to kick in an empty room.
Begging captors to not kill them instead of taking a more assertive or tactical approach in communication.
Quickly moves with Piper into the machine room and closes his phone, preparing for next actions.
Admits to being scared of guns and unfamiliar with them.
Determines to use guns despite fear to help save Vicki.
Attempts to help by suggesting common items (twine, bottle cap, soap).
Does not assert dominance or boast despite Piper's frustrations.
Attempts to jury-rig a solution with twine and a bottle cap, looking for improvised materials.
Refuses to admit he’s unfamiliar with guns until pressured, then awkwardly tries to handle guns despite inexperience.
Shows determination and willingness to step out of comfort zone to help despite lack of skills with guns.
Lunges to shield Piper from a guard's gunfire heroically.
Compliments Piper by acknowledging a shared joke and receives a genuine smile, showing openness to bonding.
Insists on doing the shooting himself and exclaims about it enthusiastically, showing some self-centeredness but not negatively impacting warmth directly.
Effortlessly disarms the guard by combining a dance move and killing him to protect Piper.
Confidently leads Piper to the door where Vicki is held, showing awareness of the situation.
Fails to anticipate being caught by Constantine despite apparent confidence and knowledge of the location.
Expresses intention to preserve Cunth's life despite threat.
Shows aggression and uses violent threats toward Cunth.
Appeals to Cunth's better nature, encouraging him to join the right side.
Attempts to spit in Cunth's face in an act of defiance.
Shows concern and fear when Cunth threatens to harm him physically.
Tries to intimidate Cunth with threats and taunts despite being restrained.
Attempts to spit in Cunth's face but fails.
Maintains confidence and moral stance against Cunth’s ideology.
Smiles back proudly at Piper after a silly dance, sharing a wonderful, friendly moment.
Breaks free with rage and kills enemies brutally and mercilessly without hesitation.
Shoots Cunth repeatedly in hands and feet while demanding a code, showing ruthless and violent behavior.
Breaks free of grasp with superhuman strength and swiftly kills two opponents.
Spin-kicks gun out of opponent’s hand and wins race to retrieve it.
Shoots opponent’s hands and feet to force information out of him.
Smiles proudly at allies' silly behavior after chaotic fight.
Expresses violent threats with crude humor towards Cunth.
Reassures team despite obvious danger, attempts to lighten mood with humor.
Fakes a smile at Vicki, indicating insincerity.
Makes a spontaneous, playful gesture by presenting Vicki with a makeshift ring, referencing a shared intimate moment.
Calls team members by nicknames and relies on them cooperatively during crisis.
Calmly begins disarming a nuclear bomb under extreme time pressure, instructing others to hand him specific tools.
Distracts his team with irrelevant personal talk and jokes instead of focusing fully on the critical task.
Calls Vicki 'sweetie' apologetically when she urges urgency.
Acknowledges his limitations honestly, saying he can't dismantle the bomb like expected.
Shows sarcasm and resignation about their dire situation, seeming emotionally distant.
Engages in risky, improvised attempts to save the day despite acknowledging own inadequacy.
Mocks himself and the villain Cunth, displaying bravado but also defensiveness.
Expresses frustration at complexity of bomb wiring and admits inability to defuse it traditionally.
Uses Swiss Army Knife to surgically remove the warhead from the bomb, effectively neutralizing the main threat.
Admits to not being able to disable the bomb entirely, concedes partial failure.
Runs back into a dangerous situation to retrieve his shorn hair fragments before escaping.
Runs with Vicki and Piper to escape the explosion, demonstrating teamwork and concern for others.
Proudly praises Vicki's written wedding vows publicly, showing appreciation and sincere affection.
Runs back into an exploding building to retrieve his hair fragments, then escapes with team seconds before detonation.
Successfully escapes the explosion along with teammates, showing timing and presence of mind.
Calmly acknowledges his success with 'I did it again' after a high-risk escape.
Focuses on sentimental moments after mission, showing emotional presence but no further mission-related competence.
Smiles at Vicki during the wedding vows.
Lunges to push Vicki out of the way from an attack.
Laughs together with Cunth after a brief moment of tension.
Cuts off Cunth’s genitals and kills him violently.
Pisses on Cunth’s ashes after killing him.
Successfully shoots Cunth, causing him to fall and then finishing him off decisively.
Pisses on Cunth’s ashes, a disrespectful and unprofessional behavior.
